sentences.en: All I had was money, which I pressed on her reluctant mother.
sentences.cn: 我就只有钱了，她母亲虽然不愿接受，我还是硬塞给了她。

sentences.en: Criminals are very reluctant to leave a paper trail.
sentences.cn: 罪犯非常不愿意留下案底。

sentences.en: Dr Sinclair's affirmative nod seemed a shade reluctant.
sentences.cn: 辛克莱博士虽然点头表示了同意，但还显得有点不情愿。

sentences.en: Eleanor was a reluctant, anxious pupil.
sentences.cn: 埃莉诺是个扭捏局促的小学生。

sentences.en: He was reluctant to give up the chase.
I am reluctant about asking him to do this.
sentences.cn: 我极不愿意让他去干此事.

sentences.en: I am reluctant to trust anyone totally, Your Excellency.
sentences.cn: 我不想完全相信任何人，阁下。

sentences.en: Mr Spero was reluctant to ask for help.
sentences.cn: 斯佩罗先生不愿意寻求帮助。

sentences.en: Scientific institutions have been reluctant to take corrective action.
sentences.cn: 科学机构一直不愿作出更正。

sentences.en: She was reluctant to admit she was wrong.
She's reluctant to take all the credit.
Shops are often reluctant to take back unsatisfactory goods.
sentences.cn: 商店一般都不愿收回顾客不称心的货物.

sentences.en: The brass are reluctant to fraternise with the enlisted men.
sentences.cn: 高级军官不愿意与大兵们称兄道弟。

sentences.en: The workers are reluctant to be ordered around by the employers.
sentences.cn: 工人们不愿被雇主们差来遣去地随便使唤.

sentences.en: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.cn: 我们很不愿意踏上如此漫长艰辛的回家之路。

trans.tran_cn: 不情愿的，勉强的，顽抗的，难处理的，厌恶的
